title: Jane Seymour, 68, wows in red as she joins Michael Douglas at The Kominsky Method screening
text:
At 68, Jane Seymour is a veteran of the acting scene.

And the actress showed she still has what it takes when it comes to rocking the red carpet, at a screening on Saturday.

Seymor wowed in a simple red shift dress as she joied her co-star Michael Douglas at a screening of The Kominsky Method during PaleyFest at The Paley Center for Media in New York.

New role: Jane Seymour, 68, wows in red as she joins Michael Douglas at The Kominsky Method screening in New York on Saturday

Co-stars: Seymour posed with Michael Douglas, Sarah Baker and Paul Reiser

The actress threw a white jacket over her shift.

She joins the cast for the second season of the Chuck Lorre created Netflix comedy show.

Douglas stars as Sandy Kominsky, an actor who in his youth had a brief moment of fame, and is now a successful Hollywood acting coach.

Jane recently spoke out about feeling better than ever as she ages.

Working together: Douglas stars as Sandy Kominsky, an actor who in his youth had a brief moment of fame, and is now a revered Hollywood acting coach

She told Closer magazine: 'I still feel sexy. I don't do Botox and I'm happy to fly the flag for older women,' said the former Bond girl.

'I've got plenty of wrinkles though. In fact, I'm playing a woman in her 70s right now in The Kominsky Method, so I wear a grey wig and have all my wrinkles showing. I'm very happy to do so.'

And the Live And Let Die actress - who has children Katherine, 37, Sean, 33, and 23-year-old twins John and Kristopher from previous relationships - thinks her decision to stay true to herself has helped her stay in work.

She said: 'I've never had any problems getting roles as I've grown older.'
